abstract: Analysts said the transition was expected and came as the company is riding a wave of orders for more fuel-efficient planes to new highs in profit.
snippet: Analysts said the transition was expected and came as the company is riding a wave of orders for more fuel-efficient planes to new highs in profit.
lead_paragraph: Boeing said on Tuesday that its chief executive, W. James McNerney Jr., would step aside on July 1 and be succeeded by its second-ranking executive, Dennis A. Muilenburg, an aeronautical engineer who had widely been seen as the heir apparent.

headline.main: Boeing Names Next C.E.O., Affirming Its Heir Apparent
headline.print_headline: The Heir Apparent Is Affirmed as Boeing Names Its Next Chief
